title: The Impact of the Internet of Things on Modern People
content:
How IoT Shapes Our Lives
Presented by [Your Name], 03.04.2025

title: Introduction
content: Today, we’ll explore how the Internet of Things (IoT) changes our lives. IoT is a network of devices that exchange data via the internet. We’ll cover: What is IoT, its pros and cons, the future, and conclusions.

title: What is the Internet of Things?
content: IoT is a network of physical objects connected to the internet. Think smart homes, wearables, and city sensors. IoT makes life more convenient and efficient.

title: How Does IoT Work?
content: Imagine IoT as an invisible web: devices 'talk' to each other. For example, your fridge notices you’re out of milk and notifies your phone to add it to your shopping list.

title: Positive Impact: Smart Homes
content: Smart homes are a key benefit of IoT. Statista (2023) says 50% of households use smart devices. Thermostats save up to 15% on energy, and cameras improve security.

title: Positive Impact: Health and Fitness
content: IoT helps monitor health. Fitness trackers track steps and sleep, while smart devices remind you to take meds. Gartner (2022) says 30% of users improved their health with IoT.

title: Positive Impact: Work and Business
content: In business, IoT boosts efficiency. Sensors in manufacturing cut downtime by 20% (McKinsey). Logistics and smart offices also benefit from automation.

title: Negative Impact: Privacy Concerns
content: IoT collects tons of data, which is risky. In 2021, 60% of devices had vulnerabilities (Cybersecurity Insiders). Data leaks from cameras and assistants are a real threat.

title: Negative Impact: Dependency and Stress
content: Constant connectivity to IoT devices causes stress. People check notifications dozens of times a day, leading to 'digital fatigue' and reduced focus.

title: Negative Impact: Environmental Issues
content: IoT creates 'digital waste.' Manufacturing and disposing of devices add to e-waste—50M tons annually (UN, 2023). This harms the environment.

title: The Future of IoT
content: By 2030, there’ll be 50 billion IoT devices (Cisco). Expect smart cities managing traffic and energy, and IoT in healthcare, like remote surgeries.

title: Who Benefits from IoT?
content: IoT helps everyone: individuals (convenience, health), businesses (efficiency), and governments (smart cities). For example, IoT can assist the elderly with health monitoring.

title: My Proposals
content:
1. Strengthen IoT security standards.
2. Educate people on digital hygiene.
3. Develop eco-friendly IoT tech.

title: Conclusion
content: IoT improves life but brings risks: privacy, environment, stress. The future depends on us. Let’s use IoT wisely so tech serves people, not the other way around.

title: Sources and Thanks
content:
Sources: Statista (2023), Gartner (2022), McKinsey (2022), Cybersecurity Insiders (2021), Cisco (2023), UN (2023).
